content.text:
[@Vitor](@eygl18LeuM8wrwpFm+/DRRxxP2lj1Oc+Ix4McDAQY98=.ed25519) 

I thought it was, but now that I'm reading more about it I'm coming to the understanding that that's just the ebuild files (like PKGBUILD). Many/most/all of these give you the option of using Git rather than downloading a tarball during the build, but it seems to me that your options are:

- bleeding-edge git version
- downloading release tarballs

Boo. There *must* be a distro that lets you keep the full source in a Git repo but still lets you build releases rather than following `master` -- right?!
